segments.text: The woman is just standing there, letting the sink overflow like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's ruining the cabinets and floor, and she doesn't care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in the puddle already—what is she thinking?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, climbing on an unstable stool for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're breaking rules, stealing treats right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy could fall and break something, or worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's encouraging it, reaching up like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't anyone paying attention to the mess?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The nice garden outside mocks this indoor chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to storm in and turn off that faucet myself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This negligence is going to cause real damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked everywhere, adding to the clutter.
segments.speaker: PAR
